results.title: France panorama. [No. 69/01?]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items: 1. Le Centres Economiques - fishing and harvesting pose a problem for French economists in dealing with consumers and supplying a growing urban population. 2. Pierre Cardin and the car - creations are meant to be worn for the future. He models his fashions like a sculptor. Like a car he considers “details” and “accessories” are most important. Fashions are made for the street. 3. Le Hotesses Internationales - several young women got together and created “International Hostesses” to help guide foreign businessmen arriving in Paris. 4. Gustave Courbet - an artist born 150 years ago who launched a campaign of “realism” despite much criticism and died a social outcast. An exhibition is held to celebrate his work. 5. Herbert Von Karajan - following charles Munch’s death, the Orchestra de Paris invited karajan to be its musical director. We see him rehearsing Brahms Requiem.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 68/44]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items: 1. Travaux d’equipement - Planning and development is necessary for the growing number of vehicles in Paris. More areas for car parking are being built; also a new boulevard circling Paris will be completed in two years. In the provinces, similar progress is being made to build super highways. 2. La France et L’Europe Spatials - Paris is the headquarters for the launching of the European space research. Its object is to place a stationary satelite in circular orbit for an independent European telecommunication and world-wide television use. 3. Femetres sur le Passe - A showcase on the past. The left bank of Paris is the mecca for all things antique. The 4th International Biennale Antiques Show held at the Grand Palais in Paris, 28 Sept-20 Oct 1968 for lovers of antiques and beauties of the past.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 68/40]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. Techniques: A new electronic linear motor for railway networks. A revolutionary electronic vehicle. 2. Wings: Within the framework of the General Aviation Salon in Toussus-le-Noble, near Paris, French aviatrix Hrissa Pelissier takes off on a round the world flight on a light single-engine French aircraft - an interview on her life and plane. First flight of the new Dassault light transport “Swallow”. 3. Delving into the past: An archeological mystery in the hills over Nice - the strange “Plateau of Idols”. French archeologists in Egypt.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 68/36]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. Technology - at Blagnac airport, near Toulouse, where the plants of the national Sud-Aviation company are located, the new Supersonic Anglo-French jetliner Concorde took its first official steps. 2. French youth and adventure - some people find their adventure underground. 3. The “Les Glenans” nautical centre in Britanny celebrates its 20th anniversary. 4. Paris in the year 2000. 5. Masterpieces of 16th century French tapestry at the medieval castle of Culan.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 68/35]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. The international sand castle contest on the beach at La Baule - summer vacationists in the Atlantic seaside resort of La Baule witenes the traditional annual contest between builders of sand castles and sculptures. 2. Inauguration of the new pleasure-craft port of Saint-Raphael - pleasure-craft sailing in France becomes evermore popular. 3. French track athletes prepare for the Olympics - the French national track championships give us a preview of what French athletes may expect to achieve in the coming summer Olympic Games at Mexico City. 4. About an annual fesitval: Avignon - the theatre, motion pictures, the dance, and music all featured at the annual Avignon Art Festival.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 68/28]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. A new assembly - France has gone to the polls to elect her new national Assembly. 2. Polar missions - high and low altitude parachuting to supply the French Polar bases in Greenland. 3. The Grand Prix de Paris - the Grand Prix at Longchamps race-course. 4. The Arts - new rooms in Paris’ Carnavalet Museum, devoted to 18th century French furniture.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 68/27]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. France goes to the polls - the first round of the legislative elections has resulted in sharp Gaullist gains. 2. From atop the “Imperial” - New “imperial” type two-decker buses are put to use in Paris. 3. 14th July - France on parade. 4. The Andre Masson exhibition - an exhibition of Andre Masson’s works at a gallery near the Seine River.

results.title: France panorama. [No. 68/21]
results.brief_description: French cinemagazine items including: 1. What is at stake in the French elections - The events leading up the dissolution of the French National Assembly and making ready for the new legislative elections. 2. Techniques - 765,000 volt circuit-breakers for the US. Near Paris, finishing touches on a revolutionary combustion-cell. 3. School for aces - Test Pilots’ School: routine coasting-tests for transport with feathered engines. The arts - Pierre-Yves Tremois, one of the best French engravers of the modern school.
